com.netflix.genie.web.scripts

Class ClusterSelectorScript

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.netflix.genie.web.scripts.ManagedScript
      • com.netflix.genie.web.scripts.ClusterSelectorScript

  • public class ClusterSelectorScript
extends ManagedScript
    Implementation of ManagedScript that delegates selection of a job's cluster when more than one choice is available. See also: ClusterSelector.

    The contract between the script and the Java code is that the script will be supplied global variables clusters and jobRequest which will be JSON strings representing the list (array) of clusters matching the cluster criteria tags and the job request that kicked off this evaluation. The code expects the script to either return the id of the cluster if one is selected or null if none was selected.

    Since:
    4.0.0

    • Method Detail

      • selectCluster

        @Nullable
public Cluster selectCluster(JobRequest jobRequest,
                                       java.util.Set<Cluster> clusters)
                                throws ScriptNotConfiguredException,
                                       ScriptExecutionException,
                                       GenieClusterNotFoundException
        Evaluate the script to select a cluster.
        Parameters:
        jobRequest - the job request
        clusters - the set of clusters that matched criteria
        Returns:
        the selected cluster from the input list, or null to indicate no preference
        Throws:
        ScriptNotConfiguredException - if the script is not configured or not yet compiled
        ScriptExecutionException - if the script fails to execute
        GenieClusterNotFoundException - if the script returns an id not in the input cluster list
